intro: Spatalla ramulosa, commonly known as the branched spathulate plant, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its branched stems and lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, spathaceous flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Spatalla ramulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
